alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 1:33PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley affecting Humboldt County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Martin Creek...including Paradise Valley...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Below Flood Stage is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Major flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:10 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 5.27 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:25 AM PDT Wednesday was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will begin to rise above flood stage again this afternoon and is forecast to reach 8.0 feet this evening. It will then fall Thursday morning but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...The forecast crest of 8.0 feet this evening compares to previous crests of 7.1 feet on 01/13/1980 and 8.8 feet on 1/31/1963. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Martin Creek Paradise Valle 5.5 5.2 Wed 1 pm PDT 7.5 6.3 5.9 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday at 300 AM PDT.
